meanings.sent1: He decided to larrup the rug to get rid of the dust.
meanings.sent2: The boxer larruped his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to larrup the curtains with its paws.
meanings.sent4: The storm larruped the coast, causing massive destruction.
meanings.sent5: She larruped the dough to make the perfect cookies.

meanings.sent1: The bully gave him a larrup on the shoulder.
meanings.sent2: The tree branch received a larrup from the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The pillow fight turned into a larruping match between friends.
meanings.sent4: The final larrup of the hammer sealed the deal.
meanings.sent5: The loud larrup echoed through the empty hallway.
